channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Jimmy Greaves: Ex-England & Tottenham striker dies aged 81
item.description: World Cup-winning England striker and Tottenham's record goalscorer Jimmy Greaves dies at the age of 81.

item.title: Bournville park attack: Boy held after six-year-old assaulted
item.description: West Midlands Police said the sexual assault happened in Rowheath Park in Birmingham.

item.title: Only Fools and Horses actor John Challis dies aged 79
item.description: The actor was best known for playing unscrupulous car dealer Boycie in sitcom Only Fools and Horses.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi in G7 Speakers visit to Coronation Street
item.description: US politician Nancy Pelosi was among those hearing about how TV show storylines can tackle hate.

item.title: Man arrested after woman's body found near Greenwich park
item.description: The body of a woman, aged in her 20s, is found near a community centre in Kidbrooke Park Road.

item.title: Double-decker bus crashes into Crouch End house
item.description: The bus collided with a car before crashing into the property in Crouch End, London.

item.title: Protestors line beach to oppose Sizewell C nuclear plant sea defences
item.description: About 500 people formed a 'human wall' in protest against the proposed defences for Sizewell C.

item.title: Herefordshire weather vane declared official war memorial
item.description: Helen and John Theron, from Hereford, bought the weather vane in a reclamation yard in 2009.

item.title: Shropshire mum's Lady Godiva ride raises money for charity
item.description: Grace Oakley wanted to support a suicide prevention charity because her mother took her own life.

item.title: Channel crossings: More than 400 migrants intercepted
item.description: UK authorities rescue or intercept 426 people in 14 small-boat incidents in the Channel.

item.title: Bluebird: Donald Campbell's craft dismantled in ownership row
item.description: The move is the latest stage in a bitter row between the restorers and the Ruskin Museum.

item.title: Actress Vicky McClure takes part in Alzheimer's Society Memory Walk
item.description: The Alzheimer's Society says the pandemic has been 'catastrophic' for those living with dementia.

item.title: Dorman Long tower demolished in overnight explosion
item.description: Historic England's protection of the 1950s Redcar building was quashed by the culture secretary.

item.title: Northampton: 'Friends thought we were mad opening a shop here'
item.description: Northampton has lost a host of major retailers, but independent traders say it has a bright future.

item.title: Time balls: The rise and fall of a timekeeping icon
item.description: As Hull reintroduces its glittering time ball, a look at the history of these unusual time keepers.

item.title: Bennerley Viaduct: New cycling route planned to connect bridges
item.description: The 300-mile route will connect the UK's only two surviving wrought iron viaducts.

item.title: Baby squirrel abandoned on Cambridge patio bonds with carer
item.description: The squirrel, named Paquito, formed an unexpected friendship with his temporary carer.

item.title: Salford woman shares photographs of eczema flare-ups
item.description: Kymmene Dawson shares photographs of stages of eczema flare-ups to raise awareness of the condition.

item.title: Manchester music cafe brings joy to people with dementia
item.description: People with dementia sing, play instruments and dance at the music cafe, says Manchester Camerata.

item.title: Sheringham 125-year-old shipwreck revealed by calm weather
item.description: The sunken vessel is rarely seen due to ever-changing conditions at sea.

item.title: Digbeth scene hopes to see street art across Birmingham
item.description: The Digbeth street culture festival is back - with a dream to see artwork across Birmingham.

item.title: Oldham Athletic fans hold protest against club's owners
item.description: More than 500 fans of Oldham Athletic FC carried a mock coffin in a protest outside the stadium.

item.title: Large samurai scroll among 27,000 items to be catalogued
item.description: The Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery is cataloguing 27,000 items, including the samurai scroll.

item.title: 'Dachshund disco is a children's party for your dog'
item.description: Organisers James Morgan and Anushka Fernando want to help dogs socialise again after lockdown.

item.title: How West Yorkshire influences the fashion world
item.description: From breathtaking moors to Yorkshire wit, an exhibition explores the county's impact on style.

item.title: Blessing Olusegun: Fight continues for answers over death
item.description: A vigil is held for Blessing Olusegun as campaigners retrace her steps a year after she died.

item.title: West Ham 1-2 Man Utd: Cristiano Ronaldo and Jesse Lingard score
item.description: Jesse Lingard comes off the bench to score a stunning late winner against his old side as Manchester United dramatically come from behind to beat West Ham.

item.title: England v New Zealand: Charlie Dean stars with 4-36 as hosts win second ODI by 13 runs
item.description: Rookie spinner Charlie Dean produces a superb spell to help England edge out New Zealand by 13 runs in a tense second one-day international at Worcester.

item.title: Premiership: Newcastle Falcons 20-26 Harlequins - Quins begin title defence with win
item.description: Champions Harlequins come through a tough start to their title defence from Newcastle Falcons in a thriller at Kingston Park.
